item.title: Real Madrid make signing Roma goalkeeper Alisson their 'plan A' as Brazil ace will cost at least £35m less than David de Gea or Thibaut Courtois and command half as much in wages
item.description: European champions Real are seeking to replace Keylor Navas as their No 1 goalkeeper and have been tracking Alisson, as well as Manchester United ace De Gea and star Chelsea stopper Courtois.
item.dc:abstract: Real Madrid's search for a new goalkeeper appears set to end with the signing of Brazil star Alisson from Roma this summer. The European champions are seeking to replace Keylor Navas as their No 1 and have been tracking Alisson, as well as Manchester United ace David de Gea and Chelsea stopper Thibaut Courtois. According to Marca, bringing Alisson in has become Real's 'plan A' because he will be cheaper and much easier to sign.
item.dc:creator: Robert Summerscales
item.mi:shortTitle: Real Madrid plan to sign Roma ace Alisson ahead of De Gea and Courtois
item.media:keywords: David De Gea,Real Madrid,Premier League,La liga,Chelsea,Manchester United,Transfer News,Serie A

item.title: Massimiliano Allegri declares his commitment to Juventus despite summer links with Chelsea and PSG
item.description: Fifty-year-old Italian Allegri is one of the most sought after managers in world football after winning a hat-trick of Serie A titles and reaching two Champions League finals in the past three seasons.
item.dc:abstract: Juventus manager Massimiliano Allegri has insisted that he is happy where he is amid speculation linking him with Chelsea and PSG. The 50-year-old is one of the most sought after managers in world football after winning a hat-trick of Serie A titles and reaching two Champions League finals in the past three seasons. Chelsea and PSG are both considering a change this summer, with the futures of Antonio Conte and Unai Emery far from certain.
item.dc:creator: Robert Summerscales
item.mi:shortTitle: Massimiliano Allegri happy at Juventus despite Chelsea and PSG links

item.title: Watford star Abdoulaye Doucoure says it would be a 'dream' to play for Liverpool amid interest from Premier League rivals
item.description: Abdoulaye Doucoure has impressed at Vicarage Road over the past two seasons and has been a near ever-present this campaign, starting every Premier League match bar one.
item.dc:abstract: Watford midfielder Abdoulaye Doucoure has admitted it would be a 'dream' to play for Liverpool. The 25-year-old has impressed at Vicarage Road over the past two seasons and has been a near ever-present this campaign, starting every Premier League match bar one. He was part of Javi Gracia's side blown away at Anfield earlier this month as they were beaten 5-0, and the former France Under-21 international insists he would love to line-up on the opposite side in the future.
item.dc:creator: Harry Slavin
item.mi:shortTitle: Watford star Doucoure: It would be a dream to play for Liverpool

item.title: Liverpool can win Champions League under boss Jurgen Klopp, says former Germany captain Lothar Matthaus
item.description: Jurgen Klopp has stayed true to the attacking philosophy that won him admirers in Germany and has assembled a squad capable of winning the Champions League, said Lothar Matthaus.
item.dc:abstract: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp has stayed true to the attacking philosophy that won him admirers in Germany and has assembled a squad capable of winning the Champions League, said Lothar Matthaus. Five-times European champions Liverpool are in the quarter-finals of this year's competition and face fellow Premier League side Manchester City in the first leg at Anfield on April 4. Klopp led his former club Borussia Dortmund to Bundesliga titles in 2011 and in 2012, when they also won the German Cup for a domestic double, and he steered them to the 2013 Champions League final where they lost to arch-rivals Bayern Munich.
item.dc:creator: Matt Maltby
item.mi:shortTitle: Liverpool can win Champions League under boss Klopp, says Matthaus

item.title: West Brom chief Mark Jenkins shocked by state of club's finances and admits: 'There is NO more money for wages'
item.description: West Brom chief executive Mark Jenkins admits the club have 'no more money for wages' and is shocked at the state of the Baggies. Albion are 10 points adrift of the Premier League safety line.
item.dc:abstract: West Brom chief executive Mark Jenkins admits the club have 'no more money for wages' and is shocked at the state of the Baggies. Albion are 10 points adrift of the Premier League safety line with seven games left and are expected to be relegated. Accounts filed up to June 2017 show pre-tax profits leap to £39.7million from £1million, only for Jenkins to warn about the future.
item.dc:creator: Alex Martin
item.mi:shortTitle: West Brom chief Mark Jenkins shocked by state of club's finances

item.title: Daniel Sturridge back training with West Brom physios as he nears return after month out with hamstring injury
item.description: The 28-year-old England international has played just 78 minutes since joining on loan from Liverpool and limped out of action just three minutes into West Brom's 3-0 defeat to Chelsea.
item.dc:abstract: The 28-year-old England international has played just 78 minutes since joining on loan from Liverpool and limped out of action just three minutes into West Brom's 3-0 defeat to Chelsea on February 12. He is considered doubtful to face Burnley this weekend as he steps up his recovery. However, he will have a more realistic chance of being fit to play against Swansea City on April 7.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Spencer

item.title: Former Tottenham starlet William Troost-Ekong becomes 43rd member of Common Goal with Juan Mata's initiative set to invest its £350,000
item.description: Troost-Ekong was born in Holland but began his career at Fulham and then Tottenham. However, after failing to make a breakthrough, he returned to Holland with FC Groningen.
item.dc:abstract: The initiative, started by Manchester United's Juan Mata back in August, can now boast 43 players and coaches who together hope to improve the lives of underprivileged children and adults across the globe. Troost-Ekong was born in Holland but began his football career as a trainee at Fulham and then Tottenham. However, after failing to make a breakthrough, he returned to Holland with FC Groningen.
item.dc:creator: Jaime Wright

item.title: Tottenham stars Hugo Lloris and Christian Eriksen lead the way in the highest performing players across Europe's top five leagues
item.description: Tottenham duo Hugo Lloris and Christian Eriksen are the highest rated players in their respective positions across Europe's top five leagues, according to the CIES Football Observatory.
item.dc:abstract: Tottenham duo Hugo Lloris and Christian Eriksen are the highest rated players in their respective positions across Europe's top five leagues. That is according to the CIES Football Observatory, who have ranked players from the Premier League, Serie A, Bundesliga, La Liga and Ligue 1 based on a number of criteria to find out who is performing best. Players that have played at least 45 minutes in eight league matches are ranked on six different areas of the game: rigour, recovery, distribution, take on, chance creation and shooting.
item.dc:creator: Max Winters
item.mi:shortTitle: Hugo Lloris and Christian Eriksen among Europe's top performing stars

item.title: Bayern Munich got Pep Guardiola but have been turned down by Thomas Tuchel... the German coach is an ideal fit for Arsenal (despite feud with Gunners chief scout Sven Mislintat)
item.description: KIT HOLDEN: In 2013, Pep Guardiola surprised everyone by choosing Bayern Munich. Now, Thomas Tuchel has surprised everyone by turning the Bavarian giants down.
item.dc:abstract: KIT HOLDEN: A few years ago, it was Pep Guardiola; now it is Thomas Tuchel. A young football coach, known for his tactical innovation, has decided to take a gap year, and now all anybody wants to know is where he will go next. In 2013, Guardiola surprised everyone by choosing Bayern Munich. Now, Thomas Tuchel has surprised everyone by turning them down. For Bayern CEO Karl-Heinz Rummenigge, Tuchel was always the first choice to succeed caretaker coach Jupp Heynckes, and had finally persuaded president Uli Hoeness of his cause, before both men were left blushing when Tuchel reportedly turned them down this weekend.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Salt
item.mi:shortTitle: Tuchel is similar to Guardiola and would be ideal fit for Arsenal
item.media:keywords: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang,Premier League,Arsenal,Bundesliga,Arsene Wenger,Bayern Munich,Pep Guardiola,Borussia Dortmund

item.description: MailOnline has teamed up with Carling - the official beer and cider partner of the Premier League - to give you the chance to win four tickets to Watford v Bournemouth.
item.dc:abstract: MailOnline has teamed up with Carling - the official beer and cider partner of the Premier League - to give you the chance to win four tickets to Watford v Bournemouth. The two sides go head to head at Vicarage Road on Saturday, March 31 (3pm kick-off).

item.title: Manchester City 'eye £75m move' for Isco in summer deal that would make Real Madrid ace club-record signing
item.description: Manchester City are reportedly ready to break their transfer record on Real Madrid midfielder Isco this summer. Isco has started 18 La Liga games and six Champions League matches this term.
item.dc:abstract: Manchester City are reportedly ready to break their transfer record on Real Madrid midfielder Isco this summer. Isco, 25, has started 18 La Liga games and six Champions League matches this season but, according to The Sun, he fears his playing opportunities could soon become restricted under Zinedine Zidane and is ready to quit the Bernabeu. It is claimed that City boss Pep Guardiola is willing to spend £75million on Isco, who has twice turned down City in the past but is now ready to say yes.
item.dc:creator: Robert Summerscales
item.mi:shortTitle: Manchester City 'eye £75m move' for Isco from Real Madrid
item.media:keywords: Manchester City,Real Madrid,Premier League,Pep Guardiola,La liga,Transfer News

item.title: Chelsea target Andrea Belotti not interested in bench role at a 'big club' as Italy striker says he'll only leave Torino if first-team football is on offer
item.description: Chelsea were keen on Belotti during both transfer windows in 2017, while he was also linked with Arsenal and Manchester City last summer. But the 24-year-old Italy frontman is in no rush to move on.
item.dc:abstract: Italy and Torino forward Andrea Belotti will only move to a bigger club if he can be sure he plays regularly. Chelsea were keen on Belotti during both transfer windows in 2017, while he was also linked with Arsenal and Manchester City last summer. But Belotti is in no rush to move on. 'They tell me I should go and play in a big club which plays in the big cup competitions, but I will decide what is best for me,' Belotti told state broadcaster Rai.
item.dc:creator: Robert Summerscales
item.mi:shortTitle: Chelsea target Belotti not interested in bench role at a 'big club'
